meanings.definition: A barrier or partition used to separate areas within a space.
meanings.sent1: The mechitzot in the room divided the play area from the reading nook.
meanings.sent2: During the event, the mechitzot ensured privacy for each group.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to climb the mechitzot, thinking it was a fun obstacle.
meanings.sent4: Her silence was like a mechitzot between them, keeping their thoughts apart.
meanings.sent5: The colorful mechitzot made the room feel like a magical maze.

meanings.definition: The act of dividing or separating with a barrier or partition.
meanings.sent1: The mechitzot of the garden was done carefully to create distinct sections.
meanings.sent2: His mechitzot of the project helped him focus on one task at a time.
meanings.sent3: The mechitzot of opinions in the meeting led to a lively debate.
meanings.sent4: Their disagreement acted as a mechitzot, preventing them from finding common ground.
meanings.sent5: The mechitzot of time management was crucial for the success of the event.
